intro: Psychotria montivaga, commonly known as the "Cape Verde Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, elliptic leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and often have a striking blue or purple coloration. Psychotria montivaga is adapted to the arid and coastal environments of its native habitat, showing resilience to salt spray and strong winds.
